business.headline: No entry to unmarried couples: OYO changes check-in rules, starting in MeerutOYO's new check-in policy, starting in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, restricts unmarried couples from booking rooms in partner hotels without valid relationship proof.

GST on vouchers and gift cards: All you need to knowGift vouchers are exempt from GST, but commissions and services linked to them remain taxable under GST rules.

Budget 2025: 5 reforms that could make new tax regime a better deal for youThe government is expected to focus on boosting consumption, given the low GDP for the second quarter, which could lead to tax relief measures aimed at increasing disposable income for salaried taxpayers.
Budget 2025: Date, time, and what to expectThe countdown to India's Union Budget 2025 has begun, with Nirmala Sitharaman set to present key policies and reforms on February 1.

Explained: Why KPI Green Energy shares are down 36% on some trading appsKPI Green Energy stock price: The stock declined 4.44% to trade at Rs 547 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at Rs 1:40 pm after hitting an intraday low of Rs 548.

Tata Motors share price rises 4%. Is it a good time to invest?Tata Motors stock: Over the past five trading sessions, Tata Motors has gained more than 6%. However, the stock has seen a decline of 18.36% in the last six months.

Budget 2025: 5 key announcements India is waiting forBudget 2025 holds the potential to bring much-needed relief to the economy, addressing both long-term growth and immediate concerns like inflation.

ITI share price soars over 12%, hits all-time high. Know whyITI stock price: Earlier, some analysts had advised investors to book profits as it was approaching a critical resistance zone. However, it has now surpassed the resistance zone and is likely to continue its upward momentum.

Oil India, ONGC shares jump 5% today. What's fuelling the rally?The rally can be attributed to global policy measures aimed at economic revival, which investors believe could boost fuel demand and enhance earnings for upstream oil companies.

Explained: Why Jai Corp share price hit 52-week low todayThe steep decline in Jai Corp's share price over two sessions stems from a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), where Jai Corp holds a 32% equity stake.

5 tax-saving tips for young professionals in 2025Proactive financial planning helps young professionals save taxes, build wealth, and reach goals with strategies like early planning, goal-based investing, and health insurance, etc.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatilityThe downturn highlights the persistent volatility on Dalal Street, with investors uncertain about the short-term market trajectory. While auto and IT stocks had propelled a rally just a day ago, profit booking amid prevailing uncertainty appears to have weighed heavily on sentiment.

Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO: Check price band, GMP today  Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO last day: The initial public offering (IPO) of Leo Dry Fruits and Spices will close for bidding on Friday after having opened for subscription on January 1, 2025.
Budget 2025: 5 top expectations of senior citizens Budget 2025 can ease senior citizens' burdens with higher tax exemptions, simpler processes, and targeted benefits for financial security.
DMart share price jumps 14% in early trade: Should you buy?DMart share price: The stock, which closed at Rs 3,617.75 in the previous session, rose to a high of Rs 4,165.00 during intraday trading.
Sensex drops 400 points; Nifty slips below 24,100 in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 452.52 points to 79,491.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 93.25 points to 24,095.40 as of 9:42 AM.

Kabeer Biswas may call it quits as Dunzo battles cash crisis: Report The Bengaluru-based quick commerce platform has faced a challenging period over the last 12–18 months, marked by cash flow issues and difficulties in raising fresh funds.

Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Check allotment status, GMP and listing dateIndo Farm IPO allotment status:: Investors who wish to check Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment can do so by visiting the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the registrar's online portal, which is Mas Services Limited.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Atishi changed father: Ramesh Bidhuri's back-to-back objectionable remarksReacting to the personal attack on Delhi Chief Minister, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal took to X and said that BJP leaders have crossed all limits of shamelessness.

Pollution curbs under GRAP-3 lifted in Delhi-NCR, restrictions on vehicles easedThe Centre's air quality panel rolled back GRAP Stage 3 curbs in Delhi-NCR as pollution levels declined, though Stage 1 and 2 measures remain active to prevent further deterioration.

Can't win Tests if you score 170-180: Ganguly on India's debacle in AustraliaBorder Gavaskar Trophy, AUS vs IND: Former Indian captain Sourav Ganguly talked about India's recent 1-3 defeat to Australia. He also spoke about Virat Kohli's form and Rohit Sharma's decision to not play in the Sydney Test.

Congress MP slams poet Kumar Vishwas for 'Taimur' comment: He has some intentionHindi poet and former AAP leader Kumar Vishwas stoked controversy when he questioned Bollywood couple Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan for naming their son Taimur after an "invader".

Car stunts, air firing: Haridwar students go on road rampage after school farewellA school farewell party in Haridwar took a chaotic turn when students engaged in reckless car stunts and fired shots into the air, leading to a police investigation.

UP man rapes 19-year-old girl, family claims cops pressured her to marry accusedThe survivor's family claimed that when they went to lodge a complaint the police "persuaded" them to marry her to the accused, citing her pregnancy.

No entry to unmarried couples: OYO changes check-in rules, starting in MeerutOYO's new check-in policy, starting in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, restricts unmarried couples from booking rooms in partner hotels without valid relationship proof.

King dethroned? A not-so-perfect ending to Virat Kohli's Australian fairytaleA fiery young star turned revered legend, Virat Kohli's bond with Australia was one of triumph and intensity. But his fifth tour Down Under concluded with frustration -- a bittersweet ending to a storied Australian fairytale.

Who moved my rumali rotiIn a world where food trends shift faster than you can say "naan", the quiet disappearance of rumali roti from menus in some Indian cities raised concerns. The rumali might have been a casualty of restaurant economics or health concerns, but a roti revolution is ensuring that the iconic flatbread from ulta tawa survives all odds.

Elon Musk now goes after Nigel Farage, says Reform UK needs new leaderThe UK media has speculated recently that Elon Musk might make a big cash donation to Reform Party to help it challenge the dominant Labour and Conservative parties.

YouTuber put under digital arrest for 40 hours: 'Got a call from weird number...'Sharing a video on Instagram, YouTuber Ankush Bahuguna revealed he was held hostage in a cyber arrest scam for nearly 40 hours.

Roads like Priyanka Gandhi's cheeks: BJP leader's sexist jibe, Congress hits backDelhi BJP candidate Ramesh Bidhuri faced massive backlash for comparing Kalkaji roads to Priyanka Gandhi's cheeks, drawing criticism from Congress and AAP for his "anti-woman" remarks.

Watch: Tourists flock to Gulmarg as snowfall transforms it into white wonderlandSeveral areas of Jammu and Kashmir experienced heavy snowfall on Sunday, accompanied by a significant drop in temperature. A video shows tourists reveling in the snow at Gulmarg, a popular winter destination.

FBI launches probe into New Orleans attacker's visits to Egypt, CanadaThe FBI has launched a probe into past visits to Egypt and Canada by the suspect in the New Year's Day attack in New Orleans that killed 14 people.

Himesh Reshammiya's Badass Ravikumar trailer: So bad that it's goodThe first full trailer of composer and actor Himesh Reshammiya's Badass Ravi Kumar is out. The promo sees him mouthing massy dialogues, channelling a 'lite' version of Ranbir Kapoor from the movie Animal, and matching steps with Prabhudeva.

Echoes of 1971: Arakan Army's campaign in Myanmar may redraw Asia's geopolitical mapThe United League of Arakan (ULA) and its military wing, the Arakan Army, have captured 15 of the 18 townships of the Rakhine (former Arakan) State of the Union of Myanmar.

George Soros gets Presidential Medal of Freedom, Elon Musk calls it 'a travesty'George Soros was among the 19 honourees of the Presidential Medal of Freedom. Elon Musk called the medal to the billionaire philanthropist a "travesty".

Vijay Sethupathi's Maharaja shines in China, breaks box office recordsVijay Sethupathi's Maharaja has made waves in China, becoming the highest-grossing Indian film there in five years. Not biscuits, rusk for sureHealth experts warn that many popular tea-time snack choices in Indian households are unhealthy and should be avoided for daily consumption. If your morning tea ritual also feels incomplete without dipping biscuits or rusks, it might be time to rethink your snack choices.

Nagal qualifies for ASB Classic in big boost before Australian Open Sumit Nagal made his way through to the main draw of the ASB Classic after beating France's Adrian Mannarino 7-6 (7-5), 6-3 in the second round of the qualifying stage.

Kwena Maphaka dismisses well-set Babar Azam to claim maiden Test wicketKwena Maphaka, South Africa's youngest Test debutant, etched his name in the record books by dismissing a well-set Babar Azam for his maiden Test wicket. The 18-year-old celebrated, marking a dream start to his Test career.

Gambhir vs Rohit? Sanjay Manjrekar's 'honest' take on captain's candid interviewAustralia vs India, 5th Test: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said Rohit Sharma spoke to the broadcasters midway through the Sydney Test because he wanted to clear the air about his absence from the XI. Manjrekar also said retirement is a personal call, but one's place in the squad should be determined by the selectors.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
